intro: Calvoa crassinoda, commonly known as the broad-leafed calvoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. Calvoa crassinoda is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
